title: Tropical Storm Debby | Gulf waters could help slow - moving TS Debby strengthen into Category 1 hurricane before landfall
message:
Warm Gulf waters could help slow-moving Tropical Storm Debby strengthen into Category 1 hurricaneAuthorities in Florida and Georgia are urging residents to prepare as the storm makes its way through the near-record-warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico.
Tropical storm and storm surge watches have also been issued for coastal Georgia and parts of South Carolina, including Charleston.
Warmer oceans can fuel stronger hurricanes, packing a punch with higher storm surge thanks to sea-level rise.
Destruction from water - both storm surge and flash flooding from heavy rain - claim the most lives in tropical systems.
Storm surge flooding above ground could rise to 6 to 10 feet along Florida's Big Bend.

title: Evacuations ordered , hurricane warning issued as Tropical Storm Debby Florida landfall looms
message:
Hurricane, storm surge warnings issued for FloridaA hurricane warning is in effect for:Suwannee River to the Ochlockonee RiverA Hurricane Warning means that hurricane conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area.
A tropical storm warning is in effect for:South of the Suwannee River to East Cape SableWest of the Ochlockonee River to Indian PassA tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A storm surge warning is in effect for:Aripeka northward to Indian PassA Storm Surge Warning means there is a danger of life-threatening inundation, from rising water moving inland from the coastline, during the next 36 hours in the indicated locations.
Potential impacts from Tropical Storm DebbyWIND: Hurricane conditions are expected in the hurricane warning area and possible in the hurricane watch areas early Monday, with tropical storm conditions expected to arrive this evening.
Tropical storm conditions are expected to spread northward over the tropical storm warning areas through tonight.

title: Tropical Storm Debby moving through Gulf toward Florida with hurricane warnings
message:
MIAMI (AP) — Tropical Storm Debby was strengthening rapidly Sunday and was predicted to become a hurricane as it moves through the Gulf of Mexico on a collision course with the Florida coast.
Hurricane and tropical storm warnings were in effect for portions of the northern Florida coast.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
A hurricane warning was issued for parts of the Big Bend and the Florida Panhandle, while tropical storm warnings were posted for Florida’s West Coast, the southern Florida Keys and Dry Tortugas.
We’re doing everything that we need to be prepared to face a tropical storm,” Tampa Mayor Jane Castor said.

“We’ve been in Florida our whole lives, in South Florida, so hurricanes are not really a big, big thing,” Silverman said.

title: Tropical Storm Debby closing in on Florida ; hurricane warnings issued
message:
The storm will bring powerful storm surge and flooding rains when it strikes Florida's Big Bend Coast, the hurricane center said.

title: What is storm surge ?
message:
TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA) — As Florida anticipates the arrival of Tropical Storm Debby, which will likely strengthen into a hurricane before reaching landfall Monday morning, the National Hurricane Center is issuing lots of warnings, including storm surge.
Tropical Storm Debby strengthening, expected to become hurricaneAccording to the NHC, storm surge is abnormal rising water, generated from storms, that move inland from the shoreline.
Storm Surge WarningA warning indicated that there is dangerous, life-threatening inundation from rising waters, usually within 36 hours.
TIMELINE: When Tropical Storm Debby will impact the Tampa Bay areaFactors impacting storm surgeThe NHC said storm surge is sensitive to the slightest changes and can be impacted by several factors.
Storm intensity- Higher wind speeds = Higher storm surgeForward speed- Faster storm = Higher surge at coastline, Slower storm = Surge goes further inlandSize- Larger storm = Higher surgeAngle of Approach- Perpendicular to coast = Higher storm surge, Parallel or oblique = lower storm surgeWidth and Slope of Ocean Bottom- Wide, gentle slope = Higher storm surge, Narrow, steep slope = Lower storm surgeShape of Coastline- Concave coastlines (curved inward) = Higher storm surge, Convex coastline (curved outward) = Lower storm surgeWatch Tracking the Tropics on Tuesdays at 12:30 p.m. ET/11:30 a.m. CT.Be prepared with the 2024 Hurricane Guide and stay ahead of tropical development with the Tracking the Tropics newsletter.

title: Tropical depression strengthens into Tropical Storm Debby , heading towards Florida
message:
Debby was located about 100 miles (160 kilometers) west-southwest of Key West, Florida, and it was moving toward the northwest at 15 mph (24 kph).
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
We're doing everything that we need to be prepared to face a tropical storm," Tampa Mayor Jane Castor said.
"We've been in Florida our whole lives — in South Florida — so hurricanes are not really a big, big thing," Silverman said.
Even farther west, Tropical Storm Daniel formed in the Pacific.

title: Tropical storm Debby forecast to become hurricane ; widespread rains for southeast
message:
The storm, while still battling some shear and dry air, is strengthening steadily and it should become a hurricane by Sunday night.
Once moving over land, the storm is expected to weaken and steering currents around it will slowly weaken too.
Tropical Storm Watches have recently been issued for the coast of Georgia north up to Charleston.
Hurricane Warnings are in effect for the eastern Florida Big Bend with Tropical Storm Warnings extending from the Nature Coast of Florida down to the Keys.
In addition, download the WPDE Weather App.

title: FIRST ALERT : Tropical Storm Debby heads toward Florida Big Bend
message:
The Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch have been extended northward along the Georgia and South Carolina coast to the South Santee River.
Life-threatening storm surge is possible with Tropical Storm Debby over several days.
At 8 a.m. Sunday, the center of Tropical Storm Debby was located near latitude 26.3 North, longitude 84.2 West.
A Tropical Storm Watch and Storm Surge Watch were issued forcoastal Georgia from the Mouth of St. Mary’s River to AltamahaSound.
Tropical Storm Debby will remain nearly stationary over our area as we head through the week.

message:
Tropical depression strengthens into Tropical Storm Debby as it moves through Gulf toward FloridaMIAMI (AP) — A tropical depression strengthened into Tropical Storm Debby north of Cuba on Saturday and was newly predicted to become a hurricane as it moves through the Gulf of Mexico on a collision course with Florida.
Debby is the fourth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season after Tropical Storm Alberto, Hurricane Beryl and Tropical Storm Chris, all of which formed in June.
We’re doing everything that we need to be prepared to face a tropical storm," Tampa Mayor Jane Castor said.

title: Tampa Bay braces for rain , flooding as Tropical Storm Debby nears
message:
Tropical Storm Debby continued its march toward Florida on Sunday morning, putting the Tampa Bay area under a tropical storm warning as residents braced for the first storm of what is expected to be an extremely active hurricane season.
In the Tampa Bay area, the biggest concern should be the rainfall and potential for storm surge, said Nicole Carlisle, a meteorologist in the local National Weather Service office.
Forecasters predict Tampa Bay could experience tropical storm conditions through Monday.
• • •Tampa Bay Times hurricane coverage 20245 things to know about the 2024 hurricane season, according to forecasters.
A warning from Hurricane IanWant to know what areas are flooding in Tampa Bay?

title: 8 am Sun : TS Debby Update , Top Winds Up to 60 | WMMB - AM
message:
MIAMI -- Tropical Storm Debby is intensifying, with top winds up to 60 miles per hour as it moves NNW in the Gulf.
A Tropical Storm Warning means that tropical storm conditions areexpected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A Hurricane Watch means that hurricane conditions are possiblewithin the watch area.
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions arepossible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK----------------------At 800 AM EDT (1200 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Debby waslocated near latitude 26.3 North, longitude 84.2 West.

title: Florida under hurricane watch as Tropical Depression 4 expected to strengthen into Debby
message:
MIAMI – A Hurricane Watch has been issued Saturday for a portion of the Florida Gulf coast as Tropical Depression Four is set to bring several inches of rain, strong winds and a possible life-threatening storm surge.
The FOX Forecast Center expects this disturbance to strengthen into a tropical storm over the eastern Gulf of Mexico and move northeast toward Florida’s Gulf Coast during the next 36 hours.
Additionally, a Tropical Storm Watch has been issued for the Florida Keys south of the Channel 5 Bridge.
6 Alerts have been issued along the Florida Gulf Coast on Aug. 3, 2024, as Tropical Depression 4 strengthens.
6 Here’s a look at the expected storm surge.

title: Gov . Kemp issues state of emergency ahead of potential tropical storm
message:
Brian Kemp has issued a state of emergency in Georgia ahead of a tropical depression that is expected to become a tropical storm.
Tropical Depression 4 is expected to become Tropical Storm Debby Saturday night before making landfall along Florida’s Gulf Coast and crossing over to southeast Georgia and the Atlantic coast.
Predictions show the system could come ashore as strong tropical storm or hurricane on Monday and cross over northern Florida into the Atlantic Ocean, where it’s likely to remain a tropical storm threatening Georgia and the Carolinas early next week.
A warning means storm conditions are expected within 36 hours, while a watch means they are possible within 48 hours.
“So that’s going to exacerbate not just the rainfall risk, but also the potential for storm surge and some strong winds.”The state of emergency makes state resources available to local governments.

title: Update ! Tropical Storm Debby has formed in the Gulf Of Mexico | 98 . 7 The River
message:
A Tropical Storm Watch is now in effect for the Florida coast westof Indian Pass to Mexico Beach.
A Tropical Storm Warning means that tropical storm conditions areexpected somewhere within the warning area within 36 hours.
A Tropical Storm Watch means that tropical storm conditions arepossible within the watch area, generally within 48 hours.
DISCUSSION AND OUTLOOK----------------------At 500 PM EDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Debby waslocated near latitude 23.9 North, longitude 83.2 West.
Tropical storm conditions are expected to spread northward over thetropical storm warning areas this evening and continuing throughSunday.

title: Sarasota - Manatee live updates : Tropical Storm Debby passes due west of Sarasota , Bradenton
message:
Tropical Storm Debby, the fourth named storm of the Atlantic hurricane season, has shifted west, taking Sarasota and Manatee counties out of the cone of the storm's projected path.
In 2012, Sarasota was hit by another Tropical Storm Debby that flooded streets, damaged roofs and sank boats.
(Read yesterday's Tropical Storm Debby live blog here.)
8 a.m. National Hurricane Center update as Tropical Storm Debby almost due west of Sarasota, BradentonThe projected path of Tropical Storm Debby as of 8 a.m., August 4.
Sarasota and Manatee counties remain under a Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Watch as Tropical Storm Debby passes due west of the area.

title: OFFICIALLY DEBBY : Tropical Storm Debby Forms in Southeastern Gulf
message:
ALBANY, Ga. (WALB) - Tropical Storm Debby continues to intensify this morning as the storm moves north through the eastern Gulf of Mexico just off the western coast of Florida.
While hurricane warnings have been posted for parts of the Florida Big Bend, tropical storm warnings are in effect for Grady, Thomas, Brooks, and Lowndes counties in south Georgia, with a tropical storm watch in effect for Decatur, Colquitt, Cook, Berrien, Atkinson, Clinch, and Echols counties.
Tropical storm conditions may begin to overspread those areas as early as overnight tonight into Monday morning.
Along with the threats of strong winds, there will be a small threat of isolated tornadoes near and to the right of the path of Debby.
For more South Georgia news, download the WALB News app from the Apple Store or Google Play.
